suncertify.server
Class RemoteDataImpl

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
        |
        +--java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
              |
              +--java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
                    |
                    +--suncertify.server.RemoteDataImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
DataInterface, java.rmi.Remote, java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.server.Unreferenced
public class RemoteDataImpl
extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
implements DataInterface, java.rmi.server.Unreferenced

This class indicates the single connection has been gotten for client-side application This class implements the basic services for access remote to database. More, specifically, all public methods of suncertify.db.Data are implemented in order to supply that services for others classes This implementation includes the same public methods as suncertify.db.Data class Unreferenced interface to handle possible something wrong with the client issue, where in the Unreferenced method unlockes the records that client has.

Version:
1.2 18 Mar 2003
Author:
Francisco Carlos
See Also:

Field Detail

logger

private static java.util.logging.Logger logger
The Logger instance. All log messages from this class are routed through this member. The Logger namespace is suncertify.server

dataInterface

private suncertify.db.DataInterface dataInterface
Instance of a remote cliente

lockManager

private suncertify.server.LockManager lockManager
Instance takes care of thread safety access to database

locks

private java.util.HashSet locks
Each connection object will hold its own version of a HashSet. If the connection tries to unlock a row which isn't in its HashSet then that attempt is simply ignored.

RemoteDataImpl

public RemoteDataImpl(suncertify.db.DataInterface dataInterface,
                      suncertify.server.LockManager lockManager)
               throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                      java.io.IOException
Creates an instance of remote connection for access server-side

Parameters:
dataInterface - A String indicates the datafile used by server-side
lockManager - A LockManager indicates the object takes cares of thread safety to datafile
Throws:
IOException - Thrown if something unexpected happened in the access of datafile
RemoteException - Thrown if something unexpected happened in the communictaions or at the server end
